programme.title: Tom Daley: 1.6 Seconds | Documentary
programme.desc: This feature documentary dives into the life of the UK’s diving legend. From Beijing 2008 to his gold medal in Tokyo 2020 and final Olympics in Paris 2024, Daley shares his personal journey, the pressures, losses, and triumphs that defined his career. Exclusive footage and candid moments reveal a story of resilience and growth.

programme.title: Women's Cross-Country | Cycling Mountain Bike | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Women's Cross-Country Final at Elancourt Hill, Paris, on 28/07/24. Pauline Ferrand Prevot (FRA) claimed the Gold, Haley Batten (USA) the Silver and Jenny Rissveds (SWE) the Bronze.

programme.title: Men's Gold Medal Match FRA - FIJ | Rugby Sevens | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Gold Medal Match between France and Fiji took place on 27/07/2024, at the Stade de France. France took the Gold with a Final Score FRA 28:7 FIJ.

programme.title: Men's 400m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 400m Freestyle Race was held on 27/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Lukas Maertens (GER) claimed Gold with a time of 3:41.78, Elijah Winnington (AUS) took Silver and Kim Woomin (KOR) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 400m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 400m Freestyle Race was held on 27/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Ariarne Titmus (AUS) claimed Gold with a time of 3:57.49. Summer McIntosh (CAN) took Silver and Katie Ledecky (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 4x100m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's's 4x100m Freestyle relay Final was held on 27/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Australia claimed Gold with a time of 3:28.92, The United States of America took Silver and China completed the podium.

programme.title: Tuskers Volleyball Club
programme.desc: Team USA Olympic hero Danielle Scott-Arruda travels to London, England to try to turn around the fortunes of a struggling volleyball team.

programme.title: Deva Handball Club
programme.desc: Team Sweden Olympic hero Thomas Sivertsson travels to Great Britain to try to turn around the fortunes of a struggling handball team.

programme.title: Men's 10m Air Pistol Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 10m Air Pistol Final took place at Chateauroux, France, on the 28/07/24. Xie Yu (CHN) won Gold, Federico Nilo Maldini (ITA) won Silver, and Paolo Monna (ITA) won Bronze.

programme.title: Women's 10m Air Pistol | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10m Air Pistol Final took place at Chateauroux, France, on the 28/07/24. Jin Ye Oh (KOR) won Gold with a total of 243.2 points, Yeji Kim (KOR) won Silver, and Manhu Bhaker (IND) won Bronze.

programme.title: India’s Abhinav Bindra I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of India’s first-ever individual gold medallist, Abhinav Bindra, and how he is now helping others fulfil their dreams.

programme.title: India’s Top Pistol Shooter Manu Bakher | Jee Jan Se
programme.desc: Throughout her childhood and teenage years, Manu Bakher switched sports half a dozen times. When she started practicing air pistol shooting, she knew this was the one for her. This is her amazing story.

programme.title: Women´s Team Gold Medal Match KOR - CHN | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Gold Medal Match between Republic of Korea and the Republic of China at Invalides on 28/07/24. Team Republic of Korea won Gold with a victory of 5:4. The People's Republic of China won Silver.

programme.title: How India’s top archer Deepika Kumari refused to give up
programme.desc: The incredible journey of India’s top archer from a childhood born in poverty to competing on the world’s highest stages. Though Rio ultimately ended in disappointment for Kumari, she’s not done yet.

programme.title: Mat 1: Women's -52kg, Men's -66kg Repechages/Semi-Finals/Finals | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's -52kg and Men's -66kg Finals took place on 28/07/2024 at the Champs-de-Mars Arena. At the Women's -52kg, Diyora Keldiyorova (UZB) claimed the gold, Distria Krasniqi (KOS) took the silver medal, and the two bronze medals were won by Amandine Buchard (FRA) and Larissa Pimenta (BRA). At the Men's -66kg, Hifumi Abe (JPN) won the Gold medal, while Willian Lima (BRA) took the Silver. The Bronze medals were claimed by Denis Vieru (MDA) and Gusman Kyrgyzbayev (KAZ).

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Rafaela Silva at age 21
programme.desc: At home with judo star Rafaela Silva when she was 21.

programme.title: Japan’s Nomura Tadahiro I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of Japan’s three-time gold medallist Nomura Tadahiro, and what he is doing now.

programme.title: Women's Street Finals | Skateboarding | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Skateboarding Street Final with Coco Yoshizawa (JPN), Liz Akama (JPN) and Rayssa Leal (BRA) at La Concorde 3, France, on 28/07/24. Coco Yoshizawa (JPN) won Gold with a total score of 272.75. Liz Akama (JPN) won the Silver Medal and Rayssa Leal (BRA) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Yuto Horigome: The Final Trick | Wait For It Paris 2024
programme.desc: Yuto Horigome defended his Olympic title in a legendary street skateboarding final at Paris 2024, sealed with a flawless last trick for the gold.

programme.title: Sterre Meijer: The influencer | skate-hers
programme.desc: Sterre Meijer is set to be the next big thing in skateboarding and social media. Among the top 5 most-followed female skaters, she's on track to become a media star.

programme.title: Christiana Means: The Road to Recovery | skate-hers
programme.desc: Christiana Means, a 25-year-old skateboarder from the Philippines raised in South Carolina, moved to LA to pursue her dream. After major knee surgery and a year of recovery, she's back and more motivated than ever to push her limits in skateboarding.

programme.title: GRLSWIRL: A Global Skate Sisterhood | skate-hers
programme.desc: Lucy Osinski, a former ballerina, discovered new power on a skateboard and founded GRLSWIRL in 2018. This all-female skate sisterhood, born in Venice Beach, embraces femininity in skating. With chapters around the world, Lucy visits Paris to highlight the vibrant community and inspiring vision of GRLSWIRL.

programme.title: Funa Nakayama: The Groundbreaker | skate-hers
programme.desc: Hailing from Toyama City, Funa Nakayama has quickly risen through the skateboarding ranks. At just 18, she's competed in top contests worldwide, earning accolades, including a bronze medal in the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. Follow Funa's journey of hard work, skill, and dedication as she breaks new ground in skateboarding.

programme.title: Women's Kayak (K1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Kayak (K1) Semifinal and Final took place at Nautical St - White Water, on 28/07/24. The Australian Jessica Fox won the Gold with a time of 96.08 seconds. Klaudia Zwolinska (POL) won the Silver, and Kimberley Woods (GBR) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Single-minded Tasiadis embraces his new start in Germany
programme.desc: Greek-born slalom canoeist Sideris Tasiadis found the focus and drive to win Olympic silver after embracing his new German surroundings.

programme.title: Men's 200m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 200m Freestyle was held on 29/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. David Popovici (ROU) claimed Gold with a time of 1:44.72. Matthew Richards (GBR) took Silver and Luke Hobson (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 100m Butterfly - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 100m Butterfly Race was held on 28/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Torri Huske (USA) claimed Gold with a time of 55.59sec, Gretchen Walsh (USA) took Sillver and Zhang Yufei (CHN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 400m Individual Medley - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 400m Individual Medley was held on 29/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Summer McIntosh (CAN) claimed Gold with a time of 4:27:17, Katie Grimes (USA) took Silver and Emma Weyant (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's 100m Backstroke - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's 100m Backstroke was held on 29/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Thomas Ceccon (ITA) claimed Gold with a time of 52.00, Xu Jiayu (CHN) took Silver and Ryan Murphy (USA) completed the podium.

programme.title: Leon Marchand’s Gold Rush | Wait For It Paris 2024
programme.desc: Leon Marchand made history in Paris. Two golds in one night. Four overall. What happened in the 114 minutes that changed everything?

programme.title: The Vault: Rebeca Andrade, rare items from the cancelled Tokyo 1940 Games, Olympic torches & swimwear throughout the years
programme.desc: Rebeca Andrade and Simon Biles leotards back-to-back in The Vault take us to the amazing world of gymnastics at the Olympics. We meet the Brazilian queen of gymnastics in training in San Paolo who shared her emotion in dethroning the American legend in the Floor event at Paris 2024 in her sparkling yellow kit. Rob explores a small but very rare collection of objects from the cancelled 1940 Tokyo Games while Jeannette finds herself in the Olympic torch room.

programme.title: Scruggs (USA) v Kiefer (USA) - Women's Foil Individual Gold Medal Bout | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Women's Foil Individual Gold Medal Bout between Lauren Scruggs (USA) and Lee Kiefer (USA) took place on 28/07/2024 at the Grand Palais Podium Piste. Lee Kiefer (USA) won Gold with a 15:6 victory over Lauren Scruggs (USA).

programme.title: Borel (FRA) v Kano (JPN) - Men's Épée Individual Gold Medal | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Men's Épée Individual Gold Medal Bout between Yannick Borel (FRA) and Koki Kano (JPN) took place on 28/07/2024 at the Grand Palais Podium Piste. Koki Kano won Gold with a 15:9 victory over Yannick Borel (FRA).

programme.title: Apithy-Brunet (FRA) v Balzer (FRA) - Women's Sabre Individual Gold Medal Bout | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Sabre Individual Gold Medal Bout between Sara Balzer (FRA) and Manon Apithy-Brunet (FRA) took place on 29/07/2024 at the Grand Palais Podium Piste. Manon Apithy-Brunet (FRA) won Gold with a 15:12 victory over Sara Balzer (FRA) who won Silver.

programme.title: Cheung (HKG) v Macchi (ITA) - Men's Foil Gold Medal Bout | Fencing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Foil Gold Medal Bout between Ka Long Cheung (HKG) and Filippo Macchi (ITA) took place on 29/07/2024 at the Grand Palais Podium Piste. Ka Long Chueng (HKG) won Gold with a 15:14 victory over Filippo Macchi (ITA) who won Silver.

programme.title: Individual All-Around Final | Rhythmic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session contains the Individual All-Around Final which took place at La Chapelle Arena, Paris at 09/08/2024.
Darja Varfolomeev (GER) won Gold, Boryana Kaleyn (BUL) won Silver and Sofia Raffaeli (ITA) won Bronze.

programme.title: Rafaela Silva at age 21
programme.desc: At home with judo star Rafaela Silva when she was 21.

programme.title: Japan’s Nomura Tadahiro I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of Japan’s three-time gold medallist Nomura Tadahiro, and what he is doing now.

programme.title: Women's Cross-Country | Cycling Mountain Bike | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Women's Cross-Country Final at Elancourt Hill, Paris, on 28/07/24. Pauline Ferrand Prevot (FRA) claimed the Gold, Haley Batten (USA) the Silver and Jenny Rissveds (SWE) the Bronze.

programme.title: Fritz/Paul (USA) v Machac/Pavlasek (CZE) - Men's Doubles Bronze Medal Match | Tennis | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Bronze Medal Match between Fritz/Paul (USA) v Machac/Pavlasek (CZE) took place on Court Philippe-Chatrier, France, on 03/08/24. Fritz/Paul (USA) claimed the Bronze, with a victory over Machac/Pavlasek (CZE), 6:3, 6:4.

programme.title: Eventing Jumping Team & Individual | Equestrian | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Eventing Jumping Team & Individual took place at Chateau de Versailles, Versailles, on 29/07/24.
In the Eventing Team Final, Great Britain won the Gold, France won Silver, and Japan completed the podium.
In the Eventing Individual Final, Michael Jung (GER) won the Gold Medal, Christopher Burton (AUS) won the Silver Medal, and Laura Collet (GBR) won Bronze.

programme.title: How horses help people overcome challenges and be their best selves.
programme.desc: Olympic Equestrian silver medallist Lucy Davis explores the immense healing power of horses and learns how her sport is changing lives.

programme.title: Women's 10m Air Rifle Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 10m Air Rifle Final took place at Chateauroux, France, on the 29/07/24. Hyojin Ban (KOR) won Gold with a total of 251.8. Yuting Huang (CHN) won Silver, and Audrey Gogniat (SUI) completed the podium.

programme.title: India’s Top Pistol Shooter Manu Bakher | Jee Jan Se
programme.desc: Throughout her childhood and teenage years, Manu Bakher switched sports half a dozen times. When she started practicing air pistol shooting, she knew this was the one for her. This is her amazing story.

programme.title: Shooting vs Cricket with Manu Bhaker and Smriti Mandhana | Sports Swap India
programme.desc: What happens in the battle of precision between cricket and shooting? The challenge is on, as Smriti Mandhana and Manu Bhaker swap the pistols and bats.

programme.title: Men's Synchronised 10m Platform | Diving | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Men's Synchonised 10m Platform Final took place at the Aquatics Centre, on 29/07/24. Lian/Yang (CHN) won Gold, Daley/Williams (GBR) won Silver, and Wiens/Zsombor-Murray (CAN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Men's Team Final | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Men's Team Final took place at the Bercy Arena, Paris, on 29/07/24. Team Japan won Gold, People's Republic of China won Silver, and the United States of America finished the podium.

programme.title: What moves me | Samir Ait Said: Finding strength in pain
programme.desc: Samir Ait Said, French artistic gymnast, suffered a severe leg injury at Rio 2016. Through a difficult comeback, while also dealing with the loss of his father, he shares the emotional journey he has been on in the last four years. From long rehabilitation to a painful mourning, he never gave up his Olympic dream and managed to find strength from his pain.

programme.title: The World Championships 2019
programme.desc: The World Championships are here. The three gymnasts learn whether they’re selected for their national teams. All the drama from the biggest competition of the season.

programme.title: It’s Not All Work
programme.desc: The off-season allows a brief break from gymnastics for Angelina. Training intensifies for a fired-up Morgan, while Yile reaches breaking point.

programme.title: Men's Cross-Country | Cycling Mountain Bike | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: Men's Cross-Country Final at Elancourt Hill, Paris, on 29/07/24. Thomas Pidcock (GBR) claimed the Gold, Victor Koretzky (FRA) the Silver, and Alan Hatherly (RSA) the Bronze.

programme.title: Matteo Zurloni Italy’s world champion climbs to the top | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Dive into the remarkable journey of Matteo Zurloni, from small town dreamer to Olympic contender. He won the speed event at the 2023 IFSC Climbing World Championships and earning a shot at Olympic glory. Follow his ascent from humble beginnings to the dizzying heights of international competition, where every climb is a test of skill, courage, and the relentless pursuit of excellence.

programme.title: Men's Team Gold Medal Match KOR - FRA | Archery | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Men's Team Gold Medal Match took place at Invalides, Paris, on 29/07/24. The Republic of Korea won the Gold Medal with a victory over France, who won Silver, 5:1

programme.title: How India’s top archer Deepika Kumari refused to give up
programme.desc: The incredible journey of India’s top archer from a childhood born in poverty to competing on the world’s highest stages. Though Rio ultimately ended in disappointment for Kumari, she’s not done yet.

programme.title: Mat 1: Women's -70kg, Men's -90kg Repechages/Semi-Finals/Finals | Judo | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Women's -70kg and Men's -90kg Finals took place on 31/07/2024 at the Champ-de-Mars Arena, Paris.
At the Women's -70kg, Barbara Matic (CRO) claimed the Gold medal, Miriam Butkereit (GER) won the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Gabriela Willems (BEL) and Michaela Polleres (AUT).
At the Men's -90kg, Lasha Bekauri (GEO) won the Gold medal, Sanshiro Murao (JPN) took the Silver, and the Bronze medals went to Theodoros Tselidis (GRE) and Maxime-Gael Ngayap Hambou (FRA).

programme.title: Nikoloz: The judo World Champion from two nations | The Starting Line
programme.desc: When Nikoloz Sherazadishvili’s family moved him from Georgia to Spain at a young age, his father instilled a love of judo in him. He quickly felt at home at the local club of Brunete, in the outskirt of Madrid, where everything started with his first coach Quino Ruiz. As he gears up for his second Olympics, surrounded by his family and friends, he’s competing on the mat for Spain but also holding Georgia and the memory of his father close to his heart.

programme.title: Men's Canoe (C1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Men's Semi-Final and Final took place at Nautical St - White water, France, on 29/07/24. Nicolas Gestin (FRA) won Gold with a time of 91.36 seconds, Adam Burgess (GBR) won Silver, and Matej Benus (SVK) completed the podium.
